alert.note: Alert for Johnson (Indiana) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Warning issued February 18 at 8:50AM EST until February 19 at 3:41PM EST by NWS Indianapolis
info.description: ...The National Weather Service in Indianapolis IN has issued a Flood Warning for the following creeks in Indiana... Sugar Creek near Edinburgh Youngs Creek at Amity Mill Creek near Cataract Big Walnut Creek near Reelsville Wildcat Creek near Jerome and at Kokomo .Brief flooding is expected to continue through much of the day for many of the smaller creeks across central Indiana. The most severe flooding will be at Amity where flooding within a foot of moderate flood stage is ongoing and will continue. Other sites will generally remain within a foot or two feet of flood stage and have either crested or nearly crested. ...FLOOD WARNING IN EFFECT FROM THIS MORNING TO TOMORROW AFTERNOON... * WHAT...Minor flooding is occurring and minor flooding is forecast. * WHERE...Sugar Creek near Edinburgh. * WHEN...From this morning to tomorrow afternoon. * IMPACTS...At 11.0 feet, In Johnson county, CR 400 S east of US 31, CR 725 E north of CR 400 S and Greensburg Road from CR 700 E to CR 800 E are closed by flood waters. Low agricultural land is flooded. A few homes and outbuildings surrounded by high water. At least one residential unit would flood if water rose another 1 to 2 feet. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 8:00 AM EST Friday the stage was 10.7 feet. - Recent Activity...The maximum river stage in the 24 hours ending at 8:00 AM EST Friday was 10.7 feet. - Forecast...The river is expected to rise to a crest of 11.1 feet this afternoon. It will then fall below flood stage late tomorrow morning. - Flood stage is 10.0 feet. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood &&
info.instruction: Motorists should not attempt to drive around barricades or drive cars through flooded areas. Additional information is available at www.weather.gov/ind. The next statement should be issued this morning by around 1100 AM EST.
